newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Nafta pushes Slovak SAX index higher.
newsitem.headline: Nafta pushes Slovak SAX index higher.

text.p: Slovak blue chips closed mixed in thinner trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange on Friday, with gains to gas storage company Nafta nudging the 12-share SAX index up 0.2 points to 208.65.
Nafta, the second most heavily capitalised issue on the index, rose 30 crowns to close at 2,060, while oil refiner Slovnaft fell 10 crowns to 920.
"Nafta appears to have bounced off its floor though still fluctuating on uncertainty before its extraordinary general shareholders meeting," Jozef Cimra, a broker at ING Barings, said.
East Slovak steel maker VSZ rose three crowns to 630, while VUB Bank closed up 15 crowns at 1,815.
Insurer Slovenska Poistovna closed unchanged at 1,920 crowns on turnover of 14.5 million, but its average trading price rose 4.17 percent.
Overall, volume dropped to 145,175 shares traded from 482,436 on Thursday, while turnover fell to 155.7 million crowns from 275.11 million.
